answers: Rocky Mountains [accept Rocky Mountain spotted fever]
parts: 1874 was termed the year of what insect, because many swarms of them destroyed crop yields in the central United States? The plagues often drew comparisons to accounts in the Book of Exodus.
This state’s governor Thomas A. Osborn approved $73,000 in bonds to help farmers affected by locusts. African-Americans migrated to this state for job opportunities as part of the Exoduster movement.
The 1874 locust plague was caused by a species named after this region. Howard T. Ricketts traced the source of a disease named after this region that was historically identified as "black measles".

answers: Arusha [accept Arusha Declaration or Arusha Tribunal]
Supreme Court of Uganda [or Ugandan Supreme Court; prompt on Supreme Court by asking "in which country?"]
parts: The proposed lingua franca for the East African Federation is this Bantu language, which names a coastal and cultural region along the Indian Ocean.

This Tanzanian city, located near the Kenyan border, would become the capital of the East Africa Federation. This city, which hosted the tribunal for the Rwandan Genocide, names a commitment to socialism issued by Julius Nyerere.
Benjamin Odoki, a former head of this body, is a key advisor in the creation of the East African Federation. In 2014, this national body struck down a controversial anti-homosexuality act.

answers: Ashanti people [or Asante people; accept Akan people]
parts: Give this material whose petrified form was used by many African artists.
These African people carve highly abstracted faces onto small fertility dolls called akwaba. They mainly use wood to carve their asesegua ("ah-say-say-goo-wa"), or ceremonial arched stools.

These other people, most of whom live in Mali, sculpted many wooden statues of worshippers with upraised, as well as intricate doors called jembetat. They perform elaborate dances with antelope-shaped walu masks and carve many dwellings out of the Bandiagara cliffs.
Name this Palestinian poet who wrote "Write down! / I am an Arab" to begin his poem "Identity Card".

This author discussed the Palestinian experience of the Middle East conflict in the essay collection Palestine's Children. Three men suffocate to death while hiding in an empty water tank in this author's novel Men in the Sun.

Palestinian author Atef Abu Seif set his book The Drone Eats With Me and a collection of stories in this largest city in the State of Palestine, which lies on a namesake strip on the Mediterranean coast.
Name this enzyme crystallized by David Phillips. Incubation with this enzyme is often used as an alternative to sonication during protein purification procedures.
Lysozyme grants antimicrobial effects to this substance secreted by the parotid (“puh-RAH-tid”) gland. It also contains amylase to digest starch into sugars.
Wound licking may be beneficial in part because saliva contains tissue factor, which activates this enzyme. This enzyme converts fibrinogen to fibrin during the clotting cascade.
A man called world's "Oldest Living Bolshevik," Aleksii Antedilluvianovich Prelapsarianov, appears in this Tony Kushner play about the AIDS crisis.
A long-lived Biblical patriarch titles this author's "metabiological pentateuch" Back to Methuselah, whose fifth act is set in A.D. 31,920, when everyone lives to be extremely old.

In the play Gem of the Ocean, this 285-year old character guides the former slave Solly Two Kings. She is 322 years old in the play Two Trains Running, in which West ignores her prophecies and throws 20 dollars into a river.

answers: grounding the circuit [or connecting the circuit to the ground or serving as the ground or any clear equivalents thereof, accept connecting the circuit to the earthor any clear equivalents thereof]
zigzag transformer [or zigzag winding, accept interconnected star transformer/winding; do not accept or prompt on "star"]
parts: Name this widely-used form of power supply, in which a linear combination of multiple alternating current sources delivers nearly-constant instantaneous power.
Three-phase power is not to be confused with the three-wire system used in household power cords; in the latter system, the third wire protects users from shocks by serving this function.
This type of transformer provides three-phase power systems a connection to the ground. It uses a winding in which the first coil on each core is connected to the second coil on the next core.

answers: No God But God: The Origins, Evolution, and Future of Islam
Zealot [or Zealots or Zelotai; accept Zealot: The Life and Time of Jesus of Nazareth]
Iran [or Islamic Republic of Iran; or Jomhuri-ye Eslami-ye Iran; do not accept or prompt on "Persia"]
parts: Name this popular history of Islam by Reza Aslan. It argues that early Islam was egalitarian and allowed only defensive jihad to promote liberal Islam.

This word titles Aslan's other best-known book, a biography of Jesus of Nazareth. This term originally named a fervently anti-Roman Jewish sect whose adherents included the sicarii ("sih-KAH-ree-ee") assassins.
Aslan's writings draw on his childhood in this country, which is ruled by a class of Shi'a mullahs led by Ali Khamenei.
Give this colony. Immigrants from this colony formed an ambulance corps that helped save lives at the Battle of Spion Kop during the Boer War.
Mahatma Gandhi fought for the rights of Indians in this present-day country by founding the Natal Indian Congress. The 1949 Durban Riots was a bitter clash between Indians and Zulus in this country.

Perhaps the largest number of Indian indentured laborers came to this country, where they were processed at its Aapravasi Ghat ("AAH-pruh-VAA-see gaat"). Seewoosagur Ramgoolam ("rahm-GOO-lum"), an Indian by descent, served as its first prime minister.

answers: heaven AND hell [accept The Marriage of Heaven and Hell]
parts: Name these two places which title a book of prophecy by William Blake, whose title in turn ironically references a treatise by Emmanuel Swedenborg.
William Blake conceived of The Marriage of Heaven and Hell as an inversion of this author's epic Paradise Lost.

A passage of The Marriage of Heaven and Hell which is named for a number of these statements describes Prudence as "a rich ugly old maid" and commands "Drive your cart and your plow over the bones of the dead".

answers: ski slopes [or ski trails, or skiing facilities; accept pistes; prompt on slopes or trails]
parts: Name this European capital city whose mayor Frank Jensen ("YEN-sen") has aimed to achieve net carbon-neutral status by 2025. It lies on the Øresund ("OE-reh-sund").

The ARC plant also serves as one of these athletic and recreational facilities in an example of "hedonistic sustainability". Their relative difficulties are indicated by such symbols as blue squares and black diamonds.

This architecture firm, founded by and named for a Danish architect, coined the term "hedonistic sustainability" to describe the ARC plant. It also designed Google’s North Bayshore HQ and has worked on implementing the Hyperloop in Dubai.
Name this psychology patient who had no episodic memory after William Scoville removed part of his brain to treat his epilepsy in 1953.
H.M. developed severe amnesia after Scoville removed this part of his brain. This seahorse-shaped part of the limbic system stores long term memories.

This psychologist was able to demonstrate both episodic and procedural memory while working with H. M. This "founder of neuropsychology" has studied how the different hemispheres of the brain interact while at McGill University.

answers: silent film [accept descriptions involving films without sound]
Sessue Hayakawa [or Kintaro Hayakawa; accept either name in reverse order]
parts: Teinosuke Kinugasa was one of the best-known directors in an era named for what kind of film? In the U.S., these films became less popular with the advent of "talkies" such as The Jazz Singer.
This actor made a cameo appearance in The Picture Bride as a benshi travelling in Hawaii. This actor played the ronin Sanjuro in Akira Kurosawa's Yojimbo.

Contemporary benshi Midori Sawato has narrated many silent films featuring this Japanese Hollywood star, such as The Dragon Painter, for Japanese audiences. Despite Hays code restrictions on his romantic roles, he was wildly popular, and later starred as Colonel Saito in the "talkie" The Bridge on the River Kwai.

answers: Venus in Furs [or Venus im Pelz]
Dream Story [or Rhapsody: A Dream Novel; or Traumnovelle]
parts: Name this novel by Leopold von Sacher-Masoch which opens with Severin's dream about the title love goddess. Its material inspired the coining of the term "masochism".
The term "masochism" is often combined with one named for this other author, whose own fucked-up novels include Justine and The 120 Days of Sodom.

In this novella by the Austrian author Arthur Schnitzler, Albertina confesses her fantasies of making love to a young Danish officer while her husband Dr. Fridolin is crucified, after which Fridolin attends a masked orgy.

answers: Fomors [accept Fomorians; accept Fomóire, Fomhóraigh, or Fomhóire ("FOH-vuh-ruh")]
Erlking [accept Erlkönig, Ellekonge, or Elverkonge; accept Herla King, Herla Cyning, Herlequin, Hellequin, or Herrequin]
parts: Name these creatures which, in the series, invade from the Atlantic Ocean after the destruction of the Red Court. In Irish myth, they are led by Balor and fight Partholón, the Nemedians, and the Tuatha Dé Danann.
In Peace Talks, this saint and the dragon Ferrovax defend Chicago from Balor's daughter Ethniu. After tackling this saint off a motorcycle, Dresden says "You're... freaking Santa Claus".
This figure leads the Wild Hunt during the assault of Demonreach. In Changes, Dresden uses the laws of hospitality to escape this horned lord of goblins.

answers: flux tubes [accept flux ropes; do not accept or prompt on "tube" or "rope"]
solenoidal [or divergence-free or incompressible; accept answers indicating the divergence of the vector field equals zero at all points]
parts: Name these regions of space whose surface normal vectors are perpendicular to the B-field lines within them. Solar eruptions are thought to be driven by "twisting" of these regions.
The Io-Jupiter flux tube carries about 5 million of these standard SI units of current.

Because the magnetic field has this property by Gauss's Law, the strength of a flux tube is constant along the tube. Helmholtz decomposition turns a vector field into a part with this property and an irrotational part.

answers: international law [or the law of nations, or jus gentium; accept The Law of Nations, Treated According to the Scientific Method; prompt on law]
parts: Name this academic field. At his court, Augustus III of Saxony sponsored a leading scholar of this field named Emer de Vattell, whose magnum opus is titled for it.
The system of international law dominant in early modern Europe is often named after this 1648 treaty which ended the Thirty Years’ War.
Much of the foundations of Westphalian international law were laid by this 17th century Dutch scholar, who wrote On the Law of War and Peace and The Free Seas.
Name this composer who adapted the Orpheus and Euridyce story into his 1600 opera Euridice ("eur-ee-DEE-chay"). His mostly-lost work Dafne is considered the earliest known opera.

Euridice's final passage "Biond' arcier, che d'alto monte" ("b'yond ahr-CHYAIR kay DAHL-toh MOHN-tay") is one of these recurring tutti passages common in Baroque operas and concertos. These passages would later inspire the rondo form.
Peri's operas also inspired this Italian composer, who also used the Orpheus and Euridyce story for his opera Orfeo. He also wrote The Coronation of Poppea.

answers: Elena Poniatowska [or Hélène Elizabeth Louise Amélie Paula Dolores Poniatowska]
parts: President Miguel de la Madrid was criticized for his poor handling of what sort of natural disaster which destroyed much of Mexico City's Centro Histórico and Tlatelolco ("tla-tell-ohl-coh") districts in 1985?

The PRI's poor handling of the earthquake was one of the reasons that led Cuauhtémoc ("kwa-ooh-tay-mok"), a member of this family, to run against it as part of the PRD. An earlier president of Mexico with this surname nationalized the country's oil industry to create Pemex.
This journalist chronicled her own experiences during the earthquake in Nothing, Nobody. Her account of the 1968 student protests in Tlatelolco was published as Massacre in Mexico.

answers: 111 ("one-one-one") [do not accept or prompt on anything else]
parts: Name this specific combination of Miller indices, which for a cubic crystal produces a triangular surface whose normal vector is a space diagonal.
Since the cubic 111 plane has the highest surface density of atoms, it is sometimes preferred to the 100 ("one-zero-zero") plane when cutting wafers of this metalloid to make integrated circuits.
Since the 111 plane has the highest surface density, it may be described by this term. The density of spheres is largest in the "hexagonal" crystal system named for this term.
